key_risks: Economic Sensitivity: Revenue tied to global economic conditions, vulnerable to downturns.
Regulatory Scrutiny: Recent scrutiny over unregistered equity sales poses legal and reputational risks.
Reputation Risks: Potential damage from missteps in executive placements or consulting advice.
Talent Dependence: High reliance on consultants' expertise and relationships, with risks from attrition.
Intense Competition: Pressure from other executive search firms and consulting firms.
controversies: Regulatory scrutiny over unregistered equity sales.
social_issues: Focus on DEI initiatives to support diverse and inclusive leadership teams.
governance_issues: Leadership changes, including the appointment of a new CFO, indicating a focus on financial and strategic leadership.

sources.title: Heidrick & Struggles - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: Heidrick & Struggles was founded in 1953 by Gardner Heidrick and John E. Struggles, both former employees of the management consulting firm Booz Allen Hamilton. [1] Their first three clients were West Virginia Coal & Coke Corporation, Northern Trust and Continental Can.
